Package importedImplementations.SanguptaBloom.bloomfilter

Class AbstractBloomFilter<T>

java.lang.Object
importedImplementations.SanguptaBloom.bloomfilter.AbstractBloomFilter<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects to be stored in the filter
All Implemented Interfaces:
BloomFilter<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
InMemoryBloomFilter
public abstract class AbstractBloomFilter<T> extends Object implements BloomFilter<T>
An abstract implementation for the bloom filter. The default composer is a simple Object.toString() decomposer which then converts this String into raw bytes. The default HashFunction used by the bloom filter is the Murmur3HashFunction. One may override the decomposer to be used, the hash function to be used as well as the implementation of the BitArray that needs to be used.
Since:
1.0
Author:
sangupta

    • AbstractBloomFilter

      protected AbstractBloomFilter(int expectedInsertions, double falsePositiveProbability)
      Create a new bloom filter.
      Parameters:
      expectedInsertions - the number of max expected insertions
      falsePositiveProbability - the max false positive probability rate that the bloom filter can give

    • AbstractBloomFilter

      Parameters:
      expectedInsertions - the number of max expected insertions
      falsePositiveProbability - the max false positive probability rate that the bloom filter can give
      decomposer - a Decomposer that helps decompose the given object

    • AbstractBloomFilter

      protected AbstractBloomFilter(int expectedInsertions, double falsePositiveProbability, Decomposer<T> decomposer, HashFunction hasher)
      Create a new bloom filter.
      Parameters:
      expectedInsertions - the number of max expected insertions
      falsePositiveProbability - the max false positive probability rate that the bloom filter can give
      decomposer - a Decomposer that helps decompose the given object
      hasher - the hash function to use. If null is specified the DEFAULT_HASHER will be used as the hashing function

      n - the number of expected insertions, or n
      p - the maximum false positive rate expected, or p
      Returns:
      the optimal size in bits for the filter, or m

      Returns:

      protected byte[] decomposedValue(T value)
      Given the value object, decompose it into a byte-array so that hashing can be done over the returned bytes. If a custom Decomposer has been specified, it will be used, otherwise the DefaultDecomposer will be used.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be decomposed
      Returns:
      the decomposed byte array

    • contains

      public boolean contains(T value)
      Check if the given value exists in the bloom filter. Note that this method may return true, indicating a false positive - but this is the property of the bloom filter and is not a bug.
      Specified by:
      contains in interface BloomFilter<T>
      Parameters:
      value - the object to be tested for existence in bloom filter
      Returns:
      false if the value is definitely (100% surety) not contained in the bloom filter, true otherwise.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • setCharset

      public void setCharset(String charsetName)
      Override the default charset that will be used when decomposing the String values into byte arrays. The default Charset used in the platform's default Charset.
      Specified by:
      setCharset in interface BloomFilter<T>
      Parameters:
      charsetName - the name of the charset that needs to be set
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the charsetName is null
      IllegalCharsetNameException - If the given charset name is illegal
      UnsupportedCharsetException - If no support for the named charset is available in this instance of the Java virtual machine
